definition: one may know a person for a long time without understanding his true nature (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 ren2 zhi1 mian4 bu4 zhi1 xin1

sentences.english: I have a good friend called Benben .
sentences.chinese: 我家有一个知心的朋友名字叫笨笨。

sentences.english: With clothes, the new are the best; with friends, the old are the best.
sentences.chinese: 衣裳是崭新的漂亮，朋友是故旧的知心。

sentences.english: Today, "High Mountain and Running Water" is a figure of speech about the bosom friends.
sentences.chinese: 今天，人们用“高山流水”来比喻知心朋友。

sentences.english: Then thousand taels of gold are easier come by than an understanding heart.
sentences.chinese: 万两黄金容易得，知心一个也难求。

sentences.english: He blabbed my confidences to every one.
sentences.chinese: 他把我告诉他的知心话告诉了每个人。

sentences.english: Will I never be able to find a real friend in the world?
sentences.chinese: 在这个世界难道找不到一个知心朋友吗？

sentences.english: I understand that we speak together in confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我明白，我们是在私下里交谈知心话”。

sentences.english: I think he needed confidantes and that is why we were fond of him"."
sentences.chinese: 我想他需要一个知心的女友，这是我们喜欢他的原因。

sentences.english: Green grass and wild flowers are my friends, shining stars my love.
sentences.chinese: 我爱小草野花的知心，更爱闪亮的夜星。

sentences.english: Hann from shallow Hu from deep, intimate life fun phase.
sentences.chinese: 汉恩自浅胡自深，人生乐在相知心。

sentences.english: I had a bosom friend who was my classmate in the university.
sentences.chinese: 大学时，我有个知心朋友，我的同学。

sentences.english: Bosom husband bridal chamber, hundred flatters thousand jiao red cranium.
sentences.chinese: 知心郎君洞房外，百媚千娇红头盖。

sentences.english: Lao Zhu used to take me into his confidence.
sentences.chinese: 老朱以前把我当作他的知心朋友。

sentences.english: If you think you don't have many friends.
sentences.chinese: 如果你觉得你没有很多知心朋友，那么他呢？

definition: to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
to know whether others are cold or hot (idiom)/to be very considerate
a friend capable of direct admonition
to be good at understanding others (idiom)
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
